context: Greek culture has evolved over thousands of years, with its <a0_0><b5_0>beginning in the Mycenaean civilization<b5_0/><a0_0/>, continuing through the Classical period, <a1_0>the <b6_0>Roman and Eastern Roman periods<b6_0/> and was profoundly affected by Christianity<a1_0/>, which it in turn influenced and shaped. Ottoman Greeks had to endure through several centuries of adversity that culminated in <a2_0><b7_0>genocide in the 20th century<b7_0/><a2_0/> but nevertheless <a3_0>included <b8_0>cultural exchanges<b8_0/> and enriched both cultures.<a3_0/> The <a4_0><b9_0>Diafotismos<b9_0/> is credited with revitalizing Greek culture<a4_0/> and giving birth to the synthesis of ancient and medieval elements that characterize it today.
